detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_compare_key_fsal: Compares two keys used in cache inode.
Compare two keys used in cache inode. These keys are basically made from FSAL related information.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] first key
[IN] second key

simplesect.para: 0 if keys are the same, 1 otherwise

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key: builds a key from the FSAL data.

Builds a key from the FSAL data. If the key is used for reading and stay local to the function pclient can be NULL (psfsdata in the scope of the current calling routine is used). If the key must survive after the end of the calling routine, a new key is allocated and ressource in *pclient are used

parameterdescription.para: [OUT] computed key
[IN] FSAL data to be used to compute the key
[INOUT] if NULL, pfsdata is used to build the key (that stay local), if not pool_key is used to allocate a new key

simplesect.para: 0 if keys if successfully build, 1 otherwise

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key: release a fsal key used to access the cache inode
Release a fsal key used to access the cache inode.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] pointer to the key to be freed
[INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.

memberdef.argsstring: (cache_inode_fsal_data_t *pfsdata, fsal_attrib_list_t *pfsal_attr, cache_inode_file_type_t type, cache_inode_create_arg_t *pcreate_arg, cache_entry_t *pentry_dir_prev, hash_table_t *ht, cache_inode_client_t *pclient, fsal_op_context_t *pcontext, unsigned int create_flag, cache_inode_status_t *pstatus)
memberdef.name: cache_inode_new_entry

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_new_entry: adds a new entry to the cache_inode.
adds a new entry to the cache_inode. These function os used to allocate entries of any kind. Some parameter are meaningless for some types or used for others.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] FSAL data for the entry to be created (used to build the key)
[in] attributes for the entry (unused if value == NULL). Used for caching.
[IN] type of the entry to be created.
[IN] if type == SYMBOLIC_LINK, this is the content of the link. Unused otherwise
[IN] if type == DIR_CONTINUE, this is the previous entry in the dir_chain. Unused otherwise.
[INOUT] hash table used for the cache.
[INOUT]ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
[IN] FSAL credentials for the operation.
[IN] a flag which shows if the entry is newly created or not
[OUT] returned status.

detaileddescription.para: cache_clean_entry: cleans an entry when it is garbagge collected.
Cleans an entry when it is garbagge collected.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] the entry to be cleaned.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_error_convert: converts an FSAL error to the corresponding cache_inode error.
Converts an FSAL error to the corresponding cache_inode error.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] fsal error to be converted.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_valid: validates an entry to update its garbagge status.
Validates an error to update its garbagge status. Entry is supposed to be locked when this function is called !!

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] entry to be validated.
[IN] can be set to CACHE_INODE_OP_GET or CACHE_INODE_OP_SET to show the type of operation done.
[INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if an errorr occured in LRU management.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_get_attributes: gets the attributes cached in the entry.
Gets the attributes cached in the entry.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the entry to deal with.
[OUT] the attributes for this entry.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_set_attributes: sets the attributes cached in the entry.
Sets the attributes cached in the entry.

parameterdescription.para: [OUT] the entry to deal with.
[IN] the attributes to be set for this entry.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_fsal_type_convert: converts an FSAL type to the cache_inode type to be used.
Converts an FSAL type to the cache_inode type to be used.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the input FSAL type.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_get_fsal_handle: gets the FSAL handle from a pentry.

Gets the FSAL handle from a pentry. The entry should be lock BEFORE this call is done (no lock is managed in this function). All DIR_BEGINNING and DIR_CONTINUE involved in the same dir_chain will return the same handle.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the input pentry.
[OUT] the status for the extraction (If not CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS, there is an error).

simplesect.para: the result of the conversion. NULL shows an error.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_type_are_rename_compatible: test if an existing entry could be scrtached during a rename.
test if an existing entry could be scrtached during a rename. No mutext management.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the source pentry (the one to be renamed)
[IN] the dest pentry (the one to be scratched during the rename)

simplesect.para: TRUE if rename if allowed (types are compatible), FALSE if not.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_mutex_destroy: destroys the pthread_mutex associated with a pentry when it is put back to the spool.
Destroys the pthread_mutex associated with a pentry when it is put back to the spool

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] the input pentry.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_print_dir: prints the content of a pentry that is a directory segment.
Prints the content of a pentry that is a DIR_BEGINNING or a DIR_CONTINUE. /!\ This function is provided for debugging purpose only, it makes no sanity check on the arguments.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the input pentry.

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_dump_content: dumps the content of a pentry to a local file (used for File Content index files).
Dumps the content of a pentry to a local file (used for File Content index files).

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the full path to the file that will contain the data.
[IN] the input pentry.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE if pentry is not related to a REGULAR_FILE

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_reload_content: reloads the content of a pentry from a local file (used File Content crash recovery).
Reloeads the content of a pentry from a local file (used File Content crash recovery).

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the full path to the file that will contain the metadata.
[IN] the input pentry.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE if pentry is not related to a REGULAR_FILE

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_invalidate_related_dirent: sets the related directory entries as invalid.
sets the related directory entries as invalid. /!\ the parent entry is supposed to be locked.

parameterdescription.para: [INOUT] entry to be managed
[IN] related pclient

detaileddescription.para: cache_inode_kill_entry: force removing an entry from the cache_inode. This is used in case of a 'stale' entry.
Force removing an entry from the cache_inode. This is used in case of a 'stale' entry.

parameterdescription.para: [IN] the input pentry (supposed to be staled).
[INOUT] the related hash table for the cache_inode cache.
[INOUT] related cache_inode client.
[OUT] status for the operation.

simplesect.para: CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE if pentry is not related a REGULAR_FILE or DIR_BEGINNING
